00031 #include <nfc/nfc.h>

00046 #define LOG_GROUP    NFC_LOG_GROUP_GENERAL
00047 #define LOG_CATEGORY "libnfc.general"
00048 
00049 void
00050 string_as_boolean(const char *s, bool *value)
00051 {
00052   if (s) {
00053     if (!(*value)) {
00054       if ((strcmp(s, "yes") == 0) ||
00055           (strcmp(s, "true") == 0) ||
00056           (strcmp(s, "1") == 0)) {
00057         *value = true;
00058         return;
00059       }
00060     } else {
00061       if ((strcmp(s, "no") == 0) ||
00062           (strcmp(s, "false") == 0) ||
00063           (strcmp(s, "0") == 0)) {
00064         *value = false;
00065         return;
00066       }
00067     }
00068   }
00069 }
00070 
00071 nfc_context *
00072 nfc_context_new(void)
00073 {
00074   nfc_context *res = malloc(sizeof(*res));
00075 
00076   if (!res) {
00077     return NULL;
00078   }
00079 
00080   // Set default context values
00081   res->allow_autoscan = true;
00082   res->allow_intrusive_scan = false;
00083 #ifdef DEBUG
00084   res->log_level = 3;
00085 #else
00086   res->log_level = 1;
00087 #endif
00088 
00089   // Clear user defined devices array
00090   for (int i = 0; i < MAX_USER_DEFINED_DEVICES; i++) {
00091     strcpy(res->user_defined_devices[i].name, "");
00092     strcpy(res->user_defined_devices[i].connstring, "");
00093     res->user_defined_devices[i].optional = false;
00094   }
00095   res->user_defined_device_count = 0;
00096 
00097 #ifdef ENVVARS
00098   // Load user defined device from environment variable at first
00099   char *envvar = getenv("LIBNFC_DEFAULT_DEVICE");
00100   if (envvar) {
00101     strcpy(res->user_defined_devices[0].name, "user defined default device");
00102     strcpy(res->user_defined_devices[0].connstring, envvar);
00103     res->user_defined_device_count++;
00104   }
00105 
00106 #endif // ENVVARS
00107 
00108 #ifdef CONFFILES
00109   // Load options from configuration file (ie. /etc/nfc/libnfc.conf)
00110   conf_load(res);
00111 #endif // CONFFILES
00112 
00113 #ifdef ENVVARS
00114   // Environment variables
00115   // Load "intrusive scan" option
00116   envvar = getenv("LIBNFC_INTRUSIVE_SCAN");
00117   string_as_boolean(envvar, &(res->allow_intrusive_scan));
00118 
00119   // log level
00120   envvar = getenv("LIBNFC_LOG_LEVEL");
00121   if (envvar) {
00122     res->log_level = atoi(envvar);
00123   }
00124 #endif // ENVVARS
00125 
00126   // Initialize log before use it...
00127   log_init(res);
00128 
00129   // Debug context state
00130 #if defined DEBUG
00131   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_NONE,  "log_level is set to %"PRIu32, res->log_level);
00132 #else
00133   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG,  "log_level is set to %"PRIu32, res->log_level);
00134 #endif
00135   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "allow_autoscan is set to %s", (res->allow_autoscan) ? "true" : "false");
00136   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "allow_intrusive_scan is set to %s", (res->allow_intrusive_scan) ? "true" : "false");
00137 
00138   log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "%d device(s) defined by user", res->user_defined_device_count);
00139   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < res->user_defined_device_count; i++) {
00140     log_put(LOG_GROUP, LOG_CATEGORY, NFC_LOG_PRIORITY_DEBUG, "  #%d name: \"%s\", connstring: \"%s\"", i, res->user_defined_devices[i].name, res->user_defined_devices[i].connstring);
00141   }
00142   return res;
00143 }
00144 
00145 void
00146 nfc_context_free(nfc_context *context)
00147 {
00148   log_exit();
00149   free(context);
00150 }

00152 void
00153 prepare_initiator_data(const nfc_modulation nm, uint8_t **ppbtInitiatorData, size_t *pszInitiatorData)
00154 {
00155   switch (nm.nmt) {
00156     case NMT_ISO14443B: {
00157       // Application Family Identifier (AFI) must equals 0x00 in order to wakeup all ISO14443-B PICCs (see ISO/IEC 14443-3)
00158       *ppbtInitiatorData = (uint8_t *) "\x00";
00159       *pszInitiatorData = 1;
00160     }
00161     break;
00162     case NMT_ISO14443BI: {
00163       // APGEN
00164       *ppbtInitiatorData = (uint8_t *) "\x01\x0b\x3f\x80";
00165       *pszInitiatorData = 4;
00166     }
00167     break;
00168     case NMT_ISO14443B2SR: {
00169       // Get_UID
00170       *ppbtInitiatorData = (uint8_t *) "\x0b";
00171       *pszInitiatorData = 1;
00172     }
00173     break;
00174     case NMT_ISO14443B2CT: {
00175       // SELECT-ALL
00176       *ppbtInitiatorData = (uint8_t *) "\x9F\xFF\xFF";
00177       *pszInitiatorData = 3;
00178     }
00179     break;
00180     case NMT_FELICA: {
00181       // polling payload must be present (see ISO/IEC 18092 11.2.2.5)
00182       *ppbtInitiatorData = (uint8_t *) "\x00\xff\xff\x01\x00";
00183       *pszInitiatorData = 5;
00184     }
00185     break;
00186     case NMT_ISO14443A:
00187     case NMT_JEWEL:
00188     case NMT_DEP:
00189       *ppbtInitiatorData = NULL;
00190       *pszInitiatorData = 0;
00191       break;
00192   }
00193 }
00194 
00195 int
00196 connstring_decode(const nfc_connstring connstring, const char *driver_name, const char *bus_name, char **pparam1, char **pparam2)
00197 {
00198   if (driver_name == NULL) {
00199     driver_name = "";
00200   }
00201   if (bus_name == NULL) {
00202     bus_name = "";
00203   }
00204   int n = strlen(connstring) + 1;
00205   char *param0 = malloc(n);
00206   if (param0 == NULL) {
00207     perror("malloc");
00208     return 0;
00209   }
00210   char *param1 = malloc(n);
00211   if (param1 == NULL) {
00212     perror("malloc");
00213     free(param0);
00214     return 0;
00215   }
00216   char *param2    = malloc(n);
00217   if (param2 == NULL) {
00218     perror("malloc");
00219     free(param0);
00220     free(param1);
00221     return 0;
00222   }
00223 
00224   char format[32];
00225   snprintf(format, sizeof(format), "%%%i[^:]:%%%i[^:]:%%%i[^:]", n - 1, n - 1, n - 1);
00226   int res = sscanf(connstring, format, param0, param1, param2);
00227 
00228   if (res < 1 || ((0 != strcmp(param0, driver_name)) &&
00229                   (bus_name != NULL) &&
00230                   (0 != strcmp(param0, bus_name)))) {
00231     // Driver name does not match.
00232     res = 0;
00233   }
00234   if (pparam1 != NULL) {
00235     if (res < 2) {
00236       free(param1);
00237       *pparam1 = NULL;
00238     } else {
00239       *pparam1 = param1;
00240     }
00241   } else {
00242     free(param1);
00243   }
00244   if (pparam2 != NULL) {
00245     if (res < 3) {
00246       free(param2);
00247       *pparam2 = NULL;
00248     } else {
00249       *pparam2 = param2;
00250     }
00251   } else {
00252     free(param2);
00253   }
00254   free(param0);
00255   return res;
00256 }
